intro: Struthanthus longibracteatus, commonly known as the long-bract evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Struthanthus longibracteatus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
